title: Nepal skittle Windies for 83 in historic series win
byline: West Indies suffered a new low as they were bowled out for just 83 to lose their T20 series with minnows Nepal in the United Arab Emirates.

title: Batters to watch at ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025
byline: As the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 approaches, attention turns to those likely to be in contention for the top run scorer prize.

title: 'We can win': Athapaththu on CWC25 opener against India
byline: Sri Lanka captain Chamari Athapaththu is confident about her side’s chances against India, ahead of their much-anticipated clash in Guwahati.

title: England bowler Woakes retires from international cricket
byline: Paceman Chris Woakes on Monday announced his retirement from international cricket after England indicated he was no longer in their plans.

title: Restructuring alone not enough to sustain SL’s debt gains: IMF
byline: Sri Lanka’s sovereign debt restructuring has eased the borrowing costs and restored investor access to financial markets. However, all is not rosy yet, as the country faces a complex post-restructuring debt portfolio that requires stronger public debt management and continued fiscal discipline, according to a new International Monetary Fund (IMF) working paper.

title: SVAT reversal threatens export competitiveness, SLFFA warns
byline: The Sri Lanka Logistics and Freight Forwarders Association (SLFFA) has joined the calls for urgent government action after the removal of the Simplified Value Added Tax (SVAT) scheme, warning the move could squeeze cash flows and undermine the country’s export sector.

title: Ceylon Chamber urges investor-friendly reforms in draft PPP Bill
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) yesterday urged the government to strengthen the draft Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Bill to make it more investor-friendly, while welcoming the government’s effort to establish a framework for private sector participation in infrastructure and services.

title: New Sri Lanka-China ‘Trusted Trader’ programme aims to certify 200 local firms by mid-2026
byline: The Sri Lanka China Business Cooperation Council (SLCBCC) has launched a new ‘Trusted Trader’ certification, projecting that 150 to 200 Sri Lankan companies will be certified by mid-2026

title: Madagascar president dissolves government after ’Gen Z’ protests
byline: Madagascar’s president has said he will dissolve his government, following days of youth-led protests over longstanding water and power cuts.

title: Afghanistan sees telecom shutdown as Taliban cut off internet
byline: The Taliban government in Afghanistan has imposed a nationwide shutdown of telecommunications, weeks after it began severing fibre-optic internet connections.

title: Wild elephant invades Govt. hospital, damages patient bed
byline: A wild elephant that roamed into Minneriya Ayurveda Hospital in the early hours of last morning had pulled down a window and taken out and destroyed a bed and an iron box used by the patients to keep their belongings. Several elderly patients were under treatment in the ward.

title: DMT launches online system for driving license renewals
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) today (30) launched the first stage of an online system to make the renewal of driving licenses more efficient.

title: Institutional corruption persists even under new Govt- key U.S. report
byline: Institutional corruption persists, particularly within sectors protected by entrenched vested interests, even under the current government, though high-level political bribery solicitation appears to have diminished, according to the U.S. statement on Sri Lanka’s investment climate.

title: Child pregnancy on the rise in Anuradhapura
byline: Pregnancy of underage girls and the rate of child mothers have been increasing in alarming proportions in the Anuradhapura area, creating a serious social issue, much to the anxiety of the authorities.

title: False news alert!
byline: Reports circulating on certain platforms claiming that Jamila Husain has resigned from her position as Editor-in-Chief of the Daily Mirror are false and misleading.

title: Ticketing made mandatory on private buses from tomorrow
byline: The Western Provincial Road Passenger Transport Authority (WPRPTA) announced that issuing and obtaining tickets on private buses will be mandatory from tomorrow (October 1).

title: Three Sri Lankans arrested for overstaying in Bengaluru
byline: Central Crime Branch (CCB) arrested three Sri Lankan men who were allegedly staying illegally in an apartment near Devanahalli. Police suspect they were involved in crimes in Sri Lanka and had been hiding in the city for several months.

title: Afghanistan telecom blackout as Taliban shut off internet
byline: The Taliban government in Afghanistan has imposed a nationwide shutdown of telecommunications, weeks after it began severing fibre-optic internet connections to prevent what it calls immorality.

title: Businessman nabbed with 75 liquor bottles at BIA
byline: A 38-year-old businessman from Puttalam, was arrested by Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) officers early yesterday (30) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle out 75 bottles of foreign liquor worth around Rs. 1 million.

title: Ministry clarifies Nobel Prize mix-up on tea achievement
byline: The Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry has clarified that the minister mistakenly referred to the Nobel Prize when speaking about the latest global achievement of Sri Lankan tea.

title: Govt cracks down on illegal ‘Hakka Patas’ and ‘Cheena Patas’ explosives
byline: The Ministry of Defence has today announced strict measures to curb the illegal production and use of banned explosives known as “Hakka Patas” and “Cheena Patas.”

title: Govt. accused of secret plan to privatise fertiliser imports
byline: The government is preparing to implement a secret plan to privatise the import of fertiliser and the supply chain, National Farmers’ Union Chairman Anuradha Tennakoon claimed.

title: Two male bodies found in Colombo
byline: Police have launched investigations after two male bodies were discovered in separate incidents in Grandpass and Dehiwala yesterday.

title: School van–bus collision injures three children
byline: Three schoolchildren and a van driver were injured this morning when a school van collided with a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus on Vauxhall Street, Colombo 02.

title: ’Feminist Collective’ condemns attack on peaceful protestors in Mannar
byline: The Feminist Collective for Economic Justice, Sri Lanka has condemned the attack on peaceful protestors in Mannar, claiming that many protestors, including women and children, have ended up in hospital.

title: University lecturers launch one-day strike over unresolved issues
byline: University lecturers across the country have launched a one-day strike today, citing the government’s failure to address ongoing problems in the higher education sector.

title: Fuel station owners warn of closures over low commission
byline: The Petroleum Distributors Association has warned that many petrol stations may have to close in the near future due to insufficient commissions paid by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Sri Lanka Petroleum Private Tanker Owners’ Association (SLPPTOA) joint Secretary D.V Shantha Silva said.

title: Shashindra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa, who is currently in remand, was today ordered to be further remanded until October 14 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: Madagascar president dissolves government after ’Gen Z’ protests
byline: Madagascar’s president has said he will dissolve his government, following days of youth-led protests over longstanding water and power cuts.

title: Afghanistan telecom blackout as Taliban shut off internet
byline: The Taliban government in Afghanistan has imposed a nationwide shutdown of telecommunications, weeks after it began severing fibre-optic internet connections to prevent what it calls immorality.

title: High Posts Committee blocks Vijitha Bandara Herath’s diplomatic posting
byline: Following Parliament’s High Posts Committee’s demonstration and its commitment to accountability by halting the nomination of H.M.V.B. Vijitha Bandara Herath to a diplomatic posting, citing grave allegations ranging from falsification of official records to the unlawful use of a government-issued passport.

title: Sri Lanka reaffirms commitment to UN on enforced disappearances
byline: Sri Lanka has reaffirmed its commitment to the United Nations Committee on Enforced Disappearances (CED), with Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara leading the country’s delegation to the 29th Session of the Committee in Geneva.

title: 39 children living with their mothers in Sri Lankan prisons: Authorities raise concerns
byline: A total of 39 children are currently living with their mothers in 10 prisons across Sri Lanka, the Prisons Department reported.

title: Police explain how to obtain clearance certificates
byline: Police clearance certificates are issued for both domestic and overseas purposes. For domestic purposes, applicants can obtain certificates from local police stations by submitting an application letter along with a copy of their National Identity Card, a valid driver’s license, or a valid passport. Police stations provide a sample application form to assist applicants.

title: Tourism Ministry says no move to promote LGBTQ tourism
byline: Following severe concerns raised by the public within the past few days, the Tourism Ministry today said the government had not decided to run a specific tourism promotion campaign targeting LGBTQ tourists.

title: Court orders eviction of encroachers from Wilpattu National Park
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Department of Wildlife Conservation to evict encroachers and take legal action against those occupying land inside Wilpattu National Park.

title: Woman celebrates 113th birthday in Anuradhapura
byline: A senior citizen from Sangili Kanadarawa in Rambewa in the Anuradhapura District, Punchage Kalumenike, celebrated her 113th birthday.

title: President invites Japanese business community to explore emerging economic opportunities in SL
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake invited the Japanese business community to join in exploring the emerging economic opportunities in Sri Lanka, while further strengthening bilateral trade and investment relations between Japan and Sri Lanka and encouraging private sector participation.

title: Underage student arrested for sharing altered nude image of schoolgirl
byline: A schoolboy, under the age of 18, who had merged a schoolgirl’s photo with a nude image and had circulated it online, was produced before Galle Additional Magistrate Maheshika Wijetunga and released on personal bail of Rs. 200,000.

title: Applications called for to fill vacancy in OMP
byline: Applications have been called for to fill a vacancy in the post of Member in the Office on Missing Persons (OMP), the Communications Department of Parliament said.

title: Chinese woman convicted after ’world’s biggest’ bitcoin seizure
byline: A Chinese national has been convicted of playing a key role in what is believed to be the single largest cryptocurrency seizure in the world, worth more than £5bn ($6.7bn).

title: Hadunnetti regrets his Nobel Prize remarks
byline: Claiming that it was a mistake to have mentioned the Nobel Prize instead of the Guinness record, Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Hadunnetti today expressed his regret if his statment had caused any inconvenice to any party.
